_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:



This document was prepared as part of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) for the OMNOVA Solutions Inc. Chester facility. The RMP conforms to the legal requirements established by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The purpose of this RMP is to:



?    Describe existing safety systems at the Chester facility that are designed to protect employees, community, environment, and the facility.

?    Share information with the Chester Community about plant operations, including steps taken to minimize risk from handling of regulated substances.

?    Comply with the applicable EPA regulations:  40 CFR Part 68.



The following executive summary presents an overview of the Chester facility's accident prevention and emergency response programs.



OMNOVA SOLUTIONS' COMMITMENT TO SAFETY:



At OMNOVA Solutions, safety is a core value. We will operate our facilities and conduct our business activities in a manner that protects the safety and health of our employees, preserves and protects the environment and maintains effective security processes. We are committed to compliance with safety, health, environmental and security laws and regulations as well as those programs we have implemented as part of the Responsible Care Guiding Principles. All OMNOVA Solutions facilities establish goals, objectives, and processes to drive continual improvement of their safety, health, environmental and security practices. This policy reflects OMNOVA's commitment to its employees, shareholders, customers and communities.



DESCRIPTION OF REGULATED PROCESSES:



OMNOVA Solutions, Chester Plant has two regulated processes.  One process uses 50% Formaldehyde Solution (49% Water) in the production of water-based permanent press finishing resins for the textiles industry. The other process uses Vinyl Acetate Monomer to produce water-based emulsion polymers for textile, construction, paint, adhesives, floor care and paper industries.  



5 YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



The EPA

regulations require regulated facilities to provide information for all accidental releases from regulated processes that resulted in (1) deaths, injuries according to the RMP definition, or significant property damage on site, or, (2) known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



No accidents meeting this regulatory definition have occurred at the Chester facility within the last five years.





ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:





OMNOVA is committed to operating safe plants and safeguarding the communities in which we operate. The Chester facility began a formal Process Safety Management Program in 1992 when OSHA promulgated ?29 CFR 1910.119.  Process Safety Management in concert with effective engineering design, Employee Safety Programs, American Chemical Council's Responsible Care Program, and Emergency Response Programs make up the Chester faciity's Accident Release Prevention Program.



The following is a partial list of activities performed at the facility that are intended to prevent emergency situations from occurring or, in the unlikely event of an emergency, being prepared to respond quickly.



?    Active participation in the Chester County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC)

?    Financial support of local emergency responders

?    Regular mechanical integrity inspections and testing of equipment

?    Identification and mitigation of hazards through Process Safety Programs

?    Testing alarms and safety systems to ensure they function properly

?    Ongoing employee safety training and drills

?    Onsite emergency response personnel

?    Contractor safety evaluations

?    24-Hour security

?    Internal and third party audits of our Responsible Care Management System

 

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:



OMNOVA Solutions' overall safety efforts consist of measures to prevent the release of hazardous materials, as well as programs to mitigate the effects of a release should it occur.  OMNOVA Solut

ions has a trained and equipped emergency response team capable of handling foreseeable emergency situations.  Specific plans are in place to respond to chemical emergencies within the facility. 



Coordination with local emergency response agencies is a key element of OMNOVA's emergency response planning process.  OMNOVA is an active participant in the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  OMNOVA also supports local emergency agencies with grants through the OMNOVA Foundation.  Continued participation in the Local Emergency Planning Committee, training and drills will sustain and improve emergency response capabilities.   



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:



OMNOVA's strategic plan includes initiatives to drive improvement in the areas of Safety, Health, Environment & Security.  These initiatives include: Awareness and Exposure Reduction, SHE&S Culture, Risk Management, Business Integration of SHE&S Processes, Social Responsibility and Security.  The facility's Annual Operating Plan includes goals and objectives in these strategic areas to drive continual improvement of our safety, health, environmental and security practices.
